👍 . Looks good. Will merge once the build is fixed.
Looks good, except one comment on getOutputSchema() .
The build has succeeded. Proceeding with merge.
code has already gone closing this pull request

@PraveenAdlakha Instead of having an API just to return the location, we can provide a generic API to return all details (whatever we store as a metadata bean). That way it is extensible. If new attributes get added to an extension metadata, everything will get returned, the Client can then filter out what it requires.

$ bin/falcon extension -detail -extensionName test 

{"detail":{"name":"test","type":"Custom extension","description":"test ing","location":"hdfs:hostname:8020\/user\/dataqa\/sampleextension"}}
+1. Will merge once the build goes through.
+1 for the changes. This might need some changes to falcon-regression. Please raise a JIRA for the same.
@pallavi-rao  ExtensionService will only be up at prism and that will take care of the requests. Please correct if I am missing some thing here.
@PraveenAdlakha ExtensionService may be up only for Prism. However, ExtensionManager is available for prism and falcon webapps. Hence the request will be accepted and may result in an improper error.
Created the jira : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FALCON-2192
ohhkk got it..Then we can do what we are doing with EntityManager and InstanceManager for better error handling.Will take it up as a separate jira.
Will merge this. There is a test case that this PR breaks. I will address that with a separate PR as @PraveenAdlakha is out on vacation.
Build has hung, but, has gone past the UT failure. Merging.

@PracheerAgarwal, can you please squash your last four commits into 1. It is easy to a diff between my last review and the new changes. Else, I'll have to look at the whole patch again OR look at each commit individually.
I have tested them in distributed mode. For embedded mode the unit tests run from FalconCLIIT so that should be sufficient

One comment which has been missed , which I had mentioned earlier too.
Can you make changes to localExtensionManager and modify org.apache.falcon.unit.TestFalconUnit#testSubmitAndScheduleExtensionJob 
to test for disabling and then update and enable it back and to check if it gets updated then
@pallavi-rao : Apologies . There were more changes into this which have been found during dev testing. I have made more changes. Please re-review it again. I have incorporated your review comments.

Currently it is: `-list                   List extension jobs and associated entities`

+1 for this.   This brings parity to HCFS mirroring support
May you please also add @PraveenAdlakha's name here? He has also become committer recently.
@sandeepSamudrala Can you elaborate on your analysis of what was the underlying cause and how this change fixes the issue?

Nevermind. I think I found the probable issue. I believe it is something on these lines. For the benefit of others it seems the issues is: https://java.net/jira/browse/JAX_WS-965 and fix is on the lines of http://www.javaroots.com/2013/09/jersey-rest-service-stream-already.html

Please, try to add as much details as possible for bug fixes. It not only helps in reviewing, but will also help users who might be affected by the same issue. 

Can you please add a test for the same? A test which will fail without the fix and pass with the fix.
